Solution code:
def solution(inorder: str, postorder: str) -> str:
    if not inorder or not postorder:
        return ''
    root_val = postorder[-1]
    root_index = inorder.index(root_val)
    left_inorder = inorder[:root_index]
    right_inorder = inorder[root_index+1:]
    left_postorder = postorder[:root_index]
    right_postorder = postorder[root_index:-1]
    left_preorder = solution(left_inorder, left_postorder)
    right_preorder = solution(right_inorder, right_postorder)
    return root_val + left_preorder + right_preorder
ChatGPT thought: To solve this problem, we can use a recursive approach. The last element in the postorder traversal will always be the root of the binary tree. We can find the index of this root in the inorder traversal and split the inorder and postorder traversals into left and right subtrees. We can then recursively build the left and right subtrees and attach them to the root. Finally, we can traverse the tree in preorder and return the result.
